intro: Known internationally for its multiple benefits, this jurisdiction has adopted measures to introduce equitable and open fiscal systems favourable to all those interested in developing successful businesses. BVI Business Companies are therefore a sound and cost-effective choice that can be used to manage bank accounts, fixed-term deposits, real estate and any other financial or commercial property. They are also an excellent choice to market or promote products and services.
GUIDELINES FOR APPLYING FOR AN EXEMPTION TO APPOINT A CUSTODIAN OR FUND MANAGER

The Securities and Investment Business Act, 2010 contemplates that custodian and management services are required to be licensed under this Act; the Mutual Funds Regulations, 2010 also specify that private and professional funds must, at all times, have a fund manager, an administrator and a custodian. These requirements in the Law have the purpose of ensuring the protection and proper management of client assets.

The BVI Financial Securities Commission is aware of certain circumstances under which the appointment of a custodian or fund manager may not apply or is not feasible. Therefore, it has issued the present guidelines based on the provisions in the Regulations for a private fund and a professional fund to be exempted from the mandatory appointment of a custodian or fund manager. In order to obtain this exemption, a request must be submitted to the BVI Financial Securities Commission in writing.
The attached Guidelines provide more details regarding the procedure and circumstances that apply for this exemption. Download the complete document here (PDF).
